description.plain:
University friends Andrew Fedyk and Joe De Pace from Canada, Ontario. Better known as Loud Luxury have been creating quite a stir in the dance music scene as of late.

With just a handful of releases under their belt, this Toronto dup and their sound – equal parts house and R&B, has garnered the support of tastemakers such as Tiësto, Martin Garrix, and Armin Van Buuren to name a few.

The fall of 2016 marked a pivotal moment for these young artists as they released a collaboration titled “Going Under“ with Borgeous which is featured on his debut album 13.
Immediately following that success, they produced a track for Tiësto’s AFTR:HRS compilation called “Fill Me In“ which hit number 2 on Spotify’s Global Viral Chart as well as hitting the Top 50 in 20 different countries' viral charts.

The duo is most well known for their debut official single release, “Body“, which received millions of streams worldwide and charted in several countries including their home nation of Canada before entering America’s Hot 100 over a year after the song’s initial release. Body ushered a new era for Loud Luxury, as well been cemented as one of the top upcoming artists to watch in dance music.

With their forthcoming release “Love No More“, the future appears bright for these young artists as they try to conquer the dance music world.

songs.title: Body

description.plain:
Featuring several references to the duo’s hometown of Toronto mixed in with a story of a complicated romance, “Body” was the first official single from deep house/pop duo Loud Luxury.

Released at the tail end of 2017 on Armin van Buuren’s record label, Armada Music, “Body” quickly became a massive hit, racking up hundreds of millions of streams worldwide and winning an MMVA for “Best Song of the Summer”. It peaked at number 3 in Canada and number 5 in the UK.

songs.lyrics:
12 ContributorsCold Feet Lyrics[Verse 1]
The city sleeps, but I'm awake
You left without saying anything
Said "I do", I guess you don't
You were never ready
Dancing tipsy in the street
We were living like a movie scene
Then you go and dropped the diamond ring
Said it got too heavy

[Chorus]
Cold, cold feet
They're walking out on me
Hide nor seek
There's a haunting melody
Singing oh, oh, oh
Where're you gonna go
Cold, cold, cold feet

[Verse 2]
Wherever you are I wish you well
Sunday morning's gonna hurt like hell
Angels singing wedding bells
They're not ringing for me
I couldn't do a thing to make you stay
Miss Julia Roberts, don't you run away
Now all that I'm left with here today
Is one hell of a story
You might also like[Bridge]
Who's gonna be enough?
Who's gonna chase your wild horses?
Who's gonna give you love?
Who's gonna chase you, who's gonna chase ya?

[Chorus]
Cold, cold feet
They're walking out on me
Hide nor seek
There's a haunting melody
Singing oh, oh, oh
Where're you gonna go
Cold, cold, cold feet1Embed
